executiveSummary: The founders of MuteMe, a Sacramento-based company, pitched their illuminated mute button product to the Sharks, seeking $200,000 for 10% equity. Despite demonstrating the productâ€™s functionality and pandemic-era relevance, the Sharks expressed concerns about cost, pricing, scalability, and market competition, ultimately leading to no deal being made.

actionItems.task: Develop a stronger marketing and content strategy, potentially leveraging TikTok for product promotion
Reduce manufacturing costs to improve margins and competitiveness
Explore a business-to-business sales model with custom logo engraving as a differentiator

nextSteps: The founders need to reassess their pricing strategy, refine their marketing approach, and explore lower-cost manufacturing options before re-engaging investors or expanding into new markets.
